title: Login
content: I get this message when I try to get to the window to enter my password: 400. That’s an error. The server cannot process the request because it is malformed. It should not be retried. That’s all we know.
creator: benprestonmail

title: New emails since 7pm last night, NOT coming thru, till NEXT day!
content:
I turned on pc, this morning. Opened Thunderbird. Checked for Updates; None. Thunderbird checks for new email from Gmail, then Compuserve (thru AOL). Taking about 3mins. Nothing past 7pm, last night. I go to Compuserve e-mail, on-line thru AOL. Messages waiting there from last night (past 7pm) and up to NOW. Had this happen before; within 2 months. If I wait until Tomorrow, the e-mails WILL come thru to my InBox. Of course then I have to go thru ALL that, PLUS today's stuff!! What is going on? I CAN read And reply thru on-line AND my connection thru my Cell phone. It can be good, on my Pc, with Thunderbird for a week or so, then Happens Again!! If I send myself a message from Gmail, it does NOT come to my Thunderbird Compuserve Inbox, but it Does show when I go On-line or to my Android Cell. I looked at my Thunderbird settings for anything that could be Filtering my e-mail, after 7pm (on Some days). Didn't see anything. I could just NOT Know Where that Particular Setting IS.... I CLOSE Thunderbird, then re-Open, and Do NOT get those NEW messages. Until a few months ago (after a 32 to 64bit update??), I don't think I had this problem (??). Even tried checking my Compuserve settings. NOTHING there, that I see that "looks" like it would cause this. When I click on Get Messages, even going to Specifically my Compuserve messages, on Thunderbird, a shaded line, on bottom right, keeps showing Something is going on, for a few minutes.

What Do I DO???
creator: RandMF

title: Can't reinstall archived mails
content:
After umpteen bugs due to Supernova I have gone back to 102, I archived my work e mails before downgrading and these appear in Profiles but I can't get them back into the archives on Thunderbird to access them. I tried the solution of creating 'Restored' and Temp but they still are not appearing. Is there a simple solution to this? It has eaten several hours of my day and I need to access the mails for work.

I have tried putting them into 

C:\Users\USER\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\u6b1hjm3.default\Mail\Local Folders

Also C:\Users\USER\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\u6b1hjm3.default\Mail\pop.orange.fr And C:\Users\USER\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\u6b1hjm3.default\ImapMail\imap.orange.fr

Nothing happens. I'm terrified I will lose them all.

title: 115.3.3 THUNDERBIRD SUPERNOVA (Bug)
content:
Ciao, ho appena effettuato l'aggiornamento di Thunderbird, versione supernova 115.3.3. Ovviamente vi sto scrivendo a seguito di varie prove e riavvii non risolutivi. Prima quando aprivo Thunderbird, qualsiasi cartella aprissi, mi faceva comparire di default l'ultima email ricevuta. Con quest'ultimo aggiornamento no, fino a quando resto nel programma mantiene in memoria l'ultima visualizzazione ma se chiudo e riapro thunderbird ogni volta devo ricliccare sull'ultima email di ogni cartella...perchè non mi visualizza nulla altrimenti.

Inoltre non c'è modo di visualizzare in alto la barra con File Modifica... e mettere sotto quella con Scarica Messaggi...ecc.

Mi succede infine che con quest'ultimo aggiornamento, di entrare in cartelle, vedere gli oggetti delle email ma se clicco su una di queste mail non vedo nulla, schermata bianca senza alcun testo.

Vi ringrazio fin da ora per il supporto e i consigli che vorrete darmi, buon pomeriggio Andrea

title: My hotmail account will no longer send ( office365 auth failure)
content:
Hi My problem: My hotmail account will no longer send emails. The error message I get is 

 From Microsoft: "We can't sign you in Your browser is currently set to block cookies. You need to allow cookies to use this service."    (NB my Firefox browser cookies is set to 'standard' and the settings had not been changed.  Plus I've tried playing with the settings, makes no difference)   From Thunderbird: "Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.office365.com timed out. Try again."

When? Started on 6 or 7 Oct, At this point, both receive and send failed. Last message was just before a Thunderbird update. We were in France, using hotel internet, which Microsoft hates. (so I didn't try to fix it until we got home).

Other info: However my hotmail address still worked well on my laptop's Outlook; internet login, Thunderbird on another laptop (Win 11, and more recent installation of Tb) and on my phone (Android, FairEmail), ie has not been blocked. My usual laptop is Win 10. All other emails within my Thunderbird are working fine. The outgoing SMTP for hotmail is: smtp://smtp.office365.com (smtp://smtp.office365.com) See image attached.

What since: A forced update of Windows (as rec'd by local techy) restored the receive function and speed, which had become sluggish. Hotmail still can't send. I've logged in and out of my microsoft account online, and have changed my MS password (and therefore that of my hotmail account), plus restarted everything lots of times. No difference. I have not got office365 except what came free with windows. I avoid office/MS apps where possible.

PLUS: Discovered that my Tb profile is humungous, 45gb, of which a fair chunk is this last couple of weeks. Most of it is not visible emails. Any advice ? - can I start a new profile and ditch the old? 

                   Help please......................

Thanks Eunice Lord
creator: eunice.lord

title: Thunderbird Downgrade From 115 To 102 Add-ons Still Think Version 115
content: Hi, My Thunderbird auto-upgraded to V115.3.3 yesterday and a number of add-ons that I use reported that they were not compatible with the new version. I didn't particularly like the appearance of the new version so I decided to downgrade back to V102. I downloaded the V102 installer, deleted compatability.ini and ran the installer. The install seems to have worked and I am back to V102.15.1 but my add-ons still think I have V115 installed so are marked as incompatible. If I look at the update history in settings the latest entry is the upgrade from V102 to V115, ie the downgrade is not showing. How do I convince my add-ons that I am back to V102 and that they are compatible?

title: Prevent nagging update notifications in version 102
content:

The nagging has been an issue for months now, since previous versions of 10x have broken the ability to read POP mail, to send mail, etc, so we have had to back-install previous versions. But always that whining, nagging update notice.

Is there any way to stop that?

title: Update to Thunderbird 115.3.3 Corrupted Profile
content:
I recently updated Thunderbird to 115.3.3. When the update was complete it appears to have split my profile into two and created two of Inbox, Drafts, Sent, and Trash. I use Earthlink which is the name of the POP3 account. Now there are Inbox, Drafts, Sent, and Trash for "Earthlink", and a set for "Local Folders". Junk and Archives are only associated with "Local Folders", and "Outbox" shows up under a "Local Folders" header along with all of the folders I used to organize received messages. When new messages are downloaded they appear in "Inbox / Local Folders". Nothing appears in any of the "Earthlink / ..." folders.

I don't recall exactly what it looked like before but there was only one set of the primary folders, and the local folders I created to organize my inbox. I have attached screenshots of the the folder navigation pane, as well as the odd organization of the "Account Settings" tab. I am admittedly not an expert. Any help is appreciated.
creator: pete48
